description: 1-5 star rating scales for the four components that determine output quality
note: These scales help LLMs infer component ratings from conversational evidence

team_execution.name: Team Execution Ability
team_execution.description: Current capability of the team to execute and deliver the output

1.label: Critical Issues
1.description: No relevant skills, high turnover, no training, frequent major errors
indicators: Team has no experience with this type of work
Team is overwhelmed and burned out

2.label: Major Issues
2.description: Basic skills, learning on the job, frequent mistakes, inconsistent quality
indicators: Team is learning as they go

3.label: Functional
3.description: Competent team, occasional errors, some training, generally meets expectations
indicators: Team has adequate skills for the job
Quality is acceptable but not excellent

4.label: Good
4.description: Skilled team, rare errors, regular training, consistently good quality
indicators: Team has strong skills and experience

5.label: Excellent
5.description: Expert team, near-zero errors, continuous improvement, best-in-class

system_capabilities.name: System Capabilities
system_capabilities.description: Current capabilities provided by the system/tools used to create the output

1.label: Critical Issues
1.description: Manual/spreadsheet-based, no automation, frequent failures, not fit for purpose
indicators: System is not designed for this use case

2.label: Major Issues
2.description: Basic tools, minimal automation, reliability issues, limited functionality

3.label: Functional
3.description: Standard tools, some automation, generally reliable, meets basic needs

4.label: Good
4.description: Modern tools, good automation, highly reliable, well-integrated

5.label: Excellent
5.description: Best-in-class tools, full automation, enterprise-grade, AI-powered

process_maturity.name: Process Maturity
process_maturity.description: Current maturity level of the process used to create the output

1.label: Critical Issues
1.description: No documented process, ad-hoc, chaotic, no standards

2.label: Major Issues
2.description: Informal process, inconsistent execution, tribal knowledge

3.label: Functional
3.description: Documented process, mostly followed, some gaps, basic monitoring

4.label: Good
4.description: Well-defined process, consistently followed, monitored, regular improvements

5.label: Excellent
5.description: Optimized process, continuous improvement, best practices, automated monitoring

dependency_quality.name: Dependency Quality
dependency_quality.description: Quality of upstream outputs that this output depends on (calculated as MIN of upstream outputs)
dependency_quality.note: This component is not directly assessed - it's calculated from upstream output quality

1.label: Critical Issues
1.description: At least one critical upstream dependency has major quality issues
indicators: Upstream data is mostly missing or incorrect

2.label: Major Issues
2.description: Upstream dependencies have significant quality issues

3.label: Functional
3.description: Upstream dependencies are adequate but not great

4.label: Good
4.description: Upstream dependencies are high quality and reliable

5.label: Excellent
5.description: All upstream dependencies are excellent quality

inference_guidelines.description: How to infer component ratings from conversational evidence
principles: Look for specific indicators mentioned by the user
Multiple indicators at the same level increase confidence
User's subjective assessment (e.g., 'team is great') should be validated with evidence
Absence of negative indicators doesn't mean high rating - look for positive evidence
When uncertain, default to middle rating (3 stars) with low confidence

confidence_levels.high: 0.8-1.0 - User explicitly confirmed or provided multiple strong indicators
confidence_levels.medium: 0.5-0.7 - Inferred from context with some supporting evidence
confidence_levels.low: 0.3-0.4 - Weak inference or assumption based on limited information
